dataset.title: Patterns in litterfall production from 12 forested sites along an elevation gradient in Pico del Este

address.deliveryPoint: University of California, Ecosystem Sciences Division Dept. of Environmental Science, Policy & Management Mulford Hall #3114

para.literalLayout: We measured litterfall from 12 sites along an upper elevation gradient every two weeks from 1994 to present. Samples are being used to estimate the litterfall productivity over time and space, identify the impacts of periodic events, and help us understand the drivers of ecosystem and biogeochemical processes with climate and vegetation change.
